conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and effects of light source position.
Initial position of light source casts shadows A, B, and C on the ground.
Light source movement to the right changes angle of light relative to objects.
Shadow A (Birdcage) will shift to the left as light source moves to the right.
Shadow B (Screw) will shift to the left as light source moves to the right.
Shadow C (Pendulum) will shift to the left as light source moves to the right.
Size of shadows will depend on angle of light source; generally longer if light source is low.
A lower light source angle results in longer shadows.
A higher light source angle results in shorter shadows.
Direction of light source determines direction of shadow movement.
All shadows (A, B, and C) will move to the left.
Shadows will likely become longer if light source is low, or remain unchanged if high.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, and C shift to the left; size increases if light source is low.
